Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Komast pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; exterior: at rim, dot band between lines; below, black-figure decoration consisting of komast (outstretched hand remaining) to right; incised blob rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 329, no. 1542)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1312) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
